bibl.title: Tsunetaro Machida v. Luther Wedin. Assignment of Errors
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: United States District Court, Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Tsunetaro Machida, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Come noo Thomas R. Horner and Edward Judd, and as attorneys for the petitioner and appellant in the above entitled cause, say:
That in the record and proceedings in this cause, and in the order and judgment entered on the 26th day of September 1921, there is manifest error, in this, to-wit:
That the court erred in not granting the writ of Habeas Corpus petitioned for, and in not discharging the petitioner from custody.

That the court erred in refusing to rule that the evidence submitted by the Government was irregular, improper and illegal, being statements and memoranda of the Inspectors and other persons not made under oath, and also being hearsay, inadmissible and not competent evidence.
That the court erred in rendering a decree and judgment discharging the writ of Habeas Corpus, and remanding the petitioner to the custody of the officers of the Immigation Department.
That the court erred in ruling that the petitioner was a person likely to become a charge upon the public.
That said order entered on the 26th day of September 1921, is not warranted by, nor supported by the facts nor the law in the premises, but is contrary thereto.
WHEREFORE, said Tsunetaro Machida, the petitoner and appelant, hereby prays that this assignment of errors be entered upon the record in this case, and that upon the hearing of this appeal it may

be adjudged by the Circuit Court of Appeals of the Ninth Circuit that the order and judgment entered on the 26th day of September 1921, be in all thingsreversed. set aside and held for naught, and that it be adjudged and decreed that thepetitioner is entitled to a writ of Habeas Corpus and to be discharged from custody thereon.
Received a copy of the within Assignment of Errors this 26th day of September 1921.
Filed in the United States District Court
